results.description: Fixtures, results and scorecards from Afghanistan's "home" series against West Indies, played in Lucknow, India - featuring a Test, three ODIs and three Twenty20 internationals.
results.title: Afghanistan v West Indies (in India) 2019

thumbnail.altText: West Indies' Carlos Brathwaite and Afghanistan's Najibullah Zadran

results.description: Phil Simmons is named West Indies coach on a four-year contract, having been sacked from his first spell in September 2016.
results.shortTitle: Simmons returns as West Indies coach
results.title: Phil Simmons returns for second spell as West Indies coach

results.description: England batsman Dawid Malan resigns as captain of Middlesex, who sign West Indies bowler Miguel Cummins on a three-year Kolpak deal.
results.shortTitle: Malan steps down as Middlesex captain
results.title: Dawid Malan: Middlesex captain stands down as Miguel Cummins joins on Kolpak deal

results.description: West Indies opening batsman Kraigg Brathwaite's bowling action is cleared as legal, for the second time, following tests in Loughborough.
results.title: Kraigg Brathwaite: West Indies star's bowling action legal after Loughborough tests

results.description: West Indies announce fixture dates and venues for a six-match limited-overs series against Ireland in January 2020.
results.shortTitle: Ireland to play WI in six-match series
results.title: Ireland to play West Indies in six-match series in January 2020

results.description: Kieron Pollard is appointed as West Indies' new limited-overs captain, despite not playing a one-day international for three years.
results.shortTitle: Pollard is West Indies ODI & T20 captain
results.title: Keiron Pollard: West Indies name all-rounder as new limited-overs captain

results.description: Middlesex sign West Indies paceman Miguel Cummins for final three games of the County Championship season.
results.shortTitle: Middlesex sign West Indies paceman Cummins
results.title: Miguel Cummins: Middlesex sign West Indies fast bowler for rest of 2019

results.description: Reports, results and scorecards India's tour of West Indies, featuring two Tests, three ODIs and three Twenty20 internationals (including two in Florida).
results.title: India in West Indies 2019

thumbnail.altText: India with the Test series trophy

results.description: Glamorgan sign West Indies batsman Kraigg Brathwaite to replace Shaun Marsh for remainder of Championship season.
results.title: Kraigg Brathwaite: West Indies batsman signs for Glamorgan

results.description: India thrash West Indies by 318 runs to win the first Test in Antigua on Sunday.
results.shortTitle: India thrash West Indies in Antigua
results.title: India thrash West Indies by 318 runs to win first Test in Antigua

results.description: England will host West Indies, Australia, Pakistan and Ireland in men's international matches next year.
results.title: England to host West Indies, Australia, Pakistan and Ireland in 2020

thumbnail.altText: England captain Eoin Morgan smiles as he holds up the World Cup trophy

results.description: Chris Gayle has us all thinking he was retiring after saluting the crowd at his latest ODI - but the West Indies legend has other ideas.
results.title: Chris Gayle: West Indies legend hasn't retired, again

results.description: Gloucestershire sign West Indies fast bowler Shannon Gabriel on a three-game County Championship contract.
results.shortTitle: Glos sign Windies fast bowler Gabriel
results.title: Shannon Gabriel: Gloucestershire sign West Indies fast bowler

results.description: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni makes himself unavailable for the tour of West Indies - to join up with his army regiment instead.
results.shortTitle: Dhoni to serve army and miss tour
results.title: MS Dhoni: Ex-India captain to serve with army regiment and miss West Indies tour

results.description: Three Australian newspapers wrongly accused the cricketer of lewd behaviour, a jury found in 2017.
results.shortTitle: Newspapers lose Chris Gayle defamation appeal
results.title: Chris Gayle: Australian newspapers lose appeal in defamation case

results.description: From Rihanna's cameo to Carlos Brathwaite's near heroics and Ben Stokes' acrobatics, we look at the highlights and lowlights of the World Cup group stage.
results.shortTitle: Rihanna, Kohli & Stokes - best (and worst) of World Cup group stage
results.title: Cricket World Cup: Kohli, Shakib and Rihanna - best of the group stage

thumbnail.altText: Rihanna and Kohli images from World Cup

results.description: Plot your team's progress to the final - full results for the World Cup in England and Wales.
results.title: Cricket World Cup: Results

results.description: Pick your team of the 2019 Cricket World Cup - then share it with friends on social media.
results.shortTitle: Pick your team of the Cricket World Cup
results.title: Cricket World Cup: Pick your team of the tournament

thumbnail.altText: Shakib, Rohit and Mitchell Starc stock images

results.description: West Indies produce a defiant display to beat bottom side Afghanistan by 23 runs in the World Cup at Headingley.
results.shortTitle: Highlights: Windies beat Afghanistan by 23 runs
results.title: Cricket World Cup: West Indies beat Afghanistan by 23 runs

thumbnail.altText: West Indies duo Chris Gayle and Fabian Allen

results.description: Fabian Allen takes a superb catch with the final ball of the match to take the wicket of Sayed Shirzad as West Indies beat Afghanistan by 23 runs in the World Cup at Headingley.
results.title: Afghanistan v West Indies: Fabian Allen takes 'outstanding catch' to dismiss Sayed Shirzad

thumbnail.altText: Fabian Allen takes an outstanding catch to dismiss Sayed Shirzad
